elements.name: start
elements.desc: Start time of an event/flow that may have a non-zero duration

elements.name: end
elements.desc: End time of an event/flow that may have a non-zero duration

elements.name: time
elements.desc: Time at which an single event occurred

elements.name: duration.s
elements.desc: Duration of an event/flow in seconds

elements.name: duration.ms
elements.desc: Duration of an event/flow in milliseconds

elements.name: duration.us
elements.desc: Duration of an event/flow in microseconds

elements.name: duration.ns
elements.desc: Duration of an event/flow in nanoseconds

elements.name: source.ip4
elements.desc: Source IPv4 address of an event/flow, or the IPv4 address from which an active measurement was taken

elements.name: source.ip6
elements.desc: Source IPv6 address of an event/flow, or the IPv6 address from which an active measurement was taken

elements.name: source.port
elements.desc: Source layer 4 port of an event/flow, or the port from which packets were sent when an active measurement was taken

elements.name: source.interface
elements.desc: A locally-scoped identifier of an interface to which the source of an event/flow is attached, or from which an active measurement was taken

elements.name: source.device
elements.desc: A locally-scoped identifier of a source device of an event/flow, or from which an active measurement was taken

elements.name: source.as
elements.desc: BGP AS number of the source of an event/flow, or AS originating an active measurement

elements.name: destination.ip4
elements.desc: The destination IPv4 address of an event/flow, or the IPv4 address of the target of an active measurement

elements.name: destination.ip6
elements.desc: The destination IPv6 address of an event/flow, or the IPv6 address of the target of an active measurement

elements.name: destination.port
elements.desc: The destination layer 4 port of an event/flow, or the port to which packets were sent when an active measurement was taken

elements.name: destination.interface
elements.desc: A locally-scoped identifier of an interface to which the destination of an event/flow is attached, or the target interface of an active measurement

elements.name: destination.device
elements.desc: A locally-scoped identifier of a destination device of an event/flow, or the target of an active measurement

elements.name: destination.as
elements.desc: BGP AS number of the destination of an event/flow, or AS target of an active measurement

elements.name: destination.url
elements.desc: A URL identifying a target of an active measurement

elements.name: observer.ip4
elements.desc: The IPv4 address of the observation point of a passive measurement

elements.name: observer.ip6
elements.desc: The IPv6 address of the observation point of a passive measurement

elements.name: observer.link
elements.desc: A locally-scoped identifier of the link on which a passive measurement was observed

elements.name: observer.interface
elements.desc: A locally-scoped identifier of the interface on which a passive measurement was observed

elements.name: observer.device
elements.desc: A locally-scoped identifier of the device on which a passive measurement was observed

elements.name: observer.as
elements.desc: BGP AS number of the observer of a passive measurement or looking glass

elements.name: intermediate.ip4
elements.desc: IPv4 address of a given entity along the path of a measurement; often scoped by hops.ip

elements.name: intermediate.ip6
elements.desc: IPv6 address of a given entity along the path of a measurement; often scoped by hops.ip

elements.name: intermediate.port
elements.desc: Layer 4 port on which a flow/event was observed on a given entity along the path; used for NAPT applications

elements.name: intermedate.as
elements.desc: BGP AS number of a given entity along the path of a measurement; often scoped by hops.as

elements.name: octets.ip
elements.desc: Count of octets at layer 3 (including IP headers) associated with a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: octets.tcp
elements.desc: Count of octets at layer 4 (including TCP headers) associated with a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: octets.udp
elements.desc: Count of octets at layer 4 (including UDP headers) associated with a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: octets.transport
elements.desc: Count of octets at layer 4 (including all sub-network-layer headers) associated with a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: octets.layer5
elements.desc: Count of octets at layer 5 (i.e., excluding network and transport layer headers) associated with a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: octets.layer7
elements.desc: Count of octets at layer 7 (i.e., passed up to the application, excluding network and transport layer headers and octets in retransmitted packets) associated with a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: packets.ip
elements.desc: Count of IP packets associated with flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: packets.tcp
elements.desc: Count of TCP segments associated with flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: packets.udp
elements.desc: Count of UDP segments associated with flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: packets.transport
elements.desc: Count of packets with a transport-layer header associated with a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: packets.layer5
elements.desc: Count of packets with non-empty transport-layer payload associated with a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: packets.layer7
elements.desc: Count of packets carrying unique data at layer 7 (i.e., packets.layer5 minus retransmissions) associated with a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: packets.duplicate
elements.desc: Count of duplicated packets observed in a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: packets.outoforder
elements.desc: Count of out-of-order packets observed in a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: packets.lost
elements.desc: Count of packets observed or inferred as lost in a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: packets.unobserved
elements.desc: Count of packets observed or inferred as delivered but unobserved in a flow, event, or measurement

elements.name: flows
elements.desc: Count of unidirectional flows (see RFC 7011) associated with an event or measurement

elements.name: flows.bidirectional
elements.desc: Count of bidirectional flows (see RFC 7011 and 5103) associated with an event or measurement

elements.name: delay.twoway.icmp.us
elements.desc: Singleton two-way delay in microseconds as measured by ICMP Echo Request/Reply (see RFC 792)

elements.name: delay.twoway.icmp.us.min
elements.desc: Minimum two-way delay in microseconds as measured by ICMP Echo Request/Reply (see RFC 792)

elements.name: delay.twoway.icmp.us.mean
elements.desc: Mean two-way delay as in microseconds measured by ICMP Echo Request/Reply (see RFC 792)

elements.name: delay.twoway.icmp.us.50pct
elements.desc: Median two-way delay in microseconds as measured by ICMP Echo Request/Reply (see RFC 792)

elements.name: delay.twoway.icmp.us.max
elements.desc: Maximum two-way delay in microseconds as measured by ICMP Echo Request/Reply (see RFC 792)

elements.name: delay.twoway.icmp.count
elements.desc: Count of valid ICMP Echo Replies received when measuring two-way delay using ICMP Echo Request/Reply (see RFC 792)

elements.name: delay.oneway.owamp.us
elements.desc: Singleton one-way delay along a path as measured by OWAMP (see RFC 3763) in microseconds

elements.name: delay.oneway.owamp.us.min
elements.desc: Minimum one-way delay along a path as measured by OWAMP (see RFC 3763) in microseconds

elements.name: delay.oneway.owamp.us.mean
elements.desc: Mean one-way delay along a path as measured by OWAMP (see RFC 3763) in microseconds

elements.name: delay.oneway.owamp.us.50pct
elements.desc: Median one-way delay along a path as measured by OWAMP (see RFC 3763) in microseconds

elements.name: delay.oneway.owamp.us.max
elements.desc: Maximum one-way delay along a path as measured by OWAMP (see RFC 3763) in microseconds

elements.name: delay.oneway.owamp.count
elements.desc: Count of samples for one-way delay measurements using OWAMP (see RFC 3763)

elements.name: delay.queue.us
elements.desc: Singleton measured or inferred delay attributable to queueing along a path in microseconds

elements.name: delay.queue.us.min
elements.desc: Minimum measured or inferred delay attributable to queueing along a path in microseconds

elements.name: delay.queue.us.mean
elements.desc: Mean measured or inferred delay attributable to queueing along a path in microseconds

elements.name: delay.queue.us.50pct
elements.desc: Median measured or inferred delay attributable to queueing along a path in microseconds

elements.name: delay.queue.us.max
elements.desc: Maximum measured or inferred delay attributable to queueing along a path in microseconds

elements.name: delay.buffer.us
elements.desc: Delay attributable to buffering at an endpoint in microseconds

elements.name: delay.resolution.ms
elements.desc: Delay from transaction start to completion of resolution of a name or URL to an address, in milliseconds

elements.name: delay.firstbyte.ms
elements.desc: Delay from transaction start to receipt of first byte of content at the initiator, in milliseconds

elements.name: rtt.ms
elements.desc: Round-trip time as measured or estimated at the sender in milliseconds

elements.name: rtt.us
elements.desc: Round-trip time as measured or estimated at the sender in microseconds

elements.name: iat.ms
elements.desc: Packet interarrival or event interoccurance time in milliseconds

elements.name: iat.us
elements.desc: Packet interarrival or event interoccurance time in microseconds

elements.name: connectivity.ip
elements.desc: Assertion (or negation) that layer 3 connectivity between the identified source and destination is available

elements.name: connectivity.as
elements.desc: Assertion (or negation) that control plane connectivity (i.e. BGP routability) between the identified source and destination is available

elements.name: hops.ip
elements.desc: Count of layer 3 hops or subhops along the identified path

elements.name: hops.as
elements.desc: Count of control-plane hops or subhops along the identified path

elements.name: bandwidth.nominal.bps
elements.desc: Nominal (advertised) bandwidth at a point or along a path in bits per second

elements.name: bandwidth.nominal.kbps
elements.desc: Nominal (advertised) bandwidth at a point or along a path in kilobits per second

elements.name: bandwidth.nominal.Mbps
elements.desc: Nominal (advertised) bandwidth at a point or along a path in megabits per second

elements.name: bandwidth.partial.bps
elements.desc: Partial bandwidth attributable to a given flow in bits per second

elements.name: bandwidth.partial.kbps
elements.desc: Partial bandwidth attributable to a given flow in kilobits per second

elements.name: bandwidth.partial.Mbps
elements.desc: Partial bandwidth attributable to a given flow in megabits per second

elements.name: bandwidth.imputed.bps
elements.desc: Bandwidth assumed to be available along a path according to measurement and heuristics in bits per second

elements.name: bandwidth.imputed.kbps
elements.desc: Bandwidth assumed to be available along a path according to measurement and heuristics in kilobits per second

elements.name: bandwidth.imputed.Mbps
elements.desc: Bandwidth assumed to be available along a path according to measurement and heuristics in megabits per second

elements.name: content.url
elements.desc: A URL identifying some content, access to which is passively or actively measured

elements.name: fps.nominal
elements.desc: Nominal frame rate in frames per second of the identified audio/video content

elements.name: fps.achieved
elements.desc: Achieved frame rate in frames per second of the identified audio/video content

elements.name: fps.achieved.min
elements.desc: Minumum achieved frame rate in frames per second of the identified audio/video content

elements.name: fps.achieved.mean
elements.desc: Mean achieved frame rate in frames per second of the identified audio/video content

elements.name: fps.achieved.max
elements.desc: Maximum achieved frame rate in frames per second of the identified audio/video content

elements.name: sessions.transport
elements.desc: Count of transport-layer sessions associated with an event

elements.name: sessions.layer7
elements.desc: Count of application-layer sessions associated with an event

elements.name: cpuload
elements.desc: Normalized CPU load on the identified device

elements.name: memload
elements.desc: Normalized memory load on the identified device

elements.name: linkload
elements.desc: Normalized link load on the identified interface or link

elements.name: bufferload
elements.desc: Normalized buffer load on the identified device

elements.name: bufferstalls
elements.desc: Count of buffer stalls (imputed playback quality degradation) associated with a flow/event

elements.name: snr
elements.desc: Signal to noise ratio in decibels, either in a radio access network or in an audio transmission context

elements.name: period.s
elements.desc: DEPRECATED and to be removed before D1.4. Use temporal scopes instead.

elements.name: period.ms
elements.desc: DEPRECATED and to be removed before D1.4. Use temporal scopes instead.

elements.name: period.us
elements.desc: DEPRECATED and to be removed before D1.4. Use temporal scopes instead.

elements.name: period.ns
elements.desc: DEPRECATED and to be removed before D1.4. Use temporal scopes instead.

elements.name: measurement.identifier
elements.desc: Free-form string identifying the implementation of the measurement on the component; often the name of the external program

elements.name: measurement.revision
elements.desc: Release or deployment serial number of the implementation of the measurement on the component

elements.name: measurement.algorithm
elements.desc: Free-form string identifying the algorithm used for the measurement on the component

elements.name: location.latitude
elements.desc: The latitude of the component expressed as a floating point number of degrees north of the equator

elements.name: location.longitude
elements.desc: The longitude of the component expressed as a floating point number of degrees east of the standard meridian (on Earth, the Prime Meridian at Greenwich)

elements.name: location.altitude
elements.desc: The altitude of the component expressed as a floating point number of meters above the standard zero altitude (on Earth, mean sea level)

elements.name: location.civil
elements.desc: A free-form identifier of the civil location (postal address, city name, building name, etc) of the component

elements.name: http.code.max
elements.desc: The maximal value of the HTTP result code during the test

elements.name: http.redirectcount.max
elements.desc: Peak of HTTP redirects during the transaction.

elements.name: qos.manifest
elements.desc: Indicating the peak of the errorcode with respect the manifest descriptor

elements.name: qos.content
elements.desc: Indicating the peak of the errorcode with respect the content

elements.name: qos.aggregate
elements.desc: The minimum of the content and the manifest quality.

elements.name: qos.level
elements.desc: Quality level expressed in percents.

elements.name: scamper.pps
elements.desc:
specifies the target packets-per-second rate for scamper to
reach.  By default, this value is 20.

elements.name: scamper.window
elements.desc:
specifies the maximum number of tasks that may be probed in par-
allel.  A value of zero places no upper limit.  By default, zero
is used.

elements.name: scamper.tracebox.udp
elements.desc: Uses UDP probes

elements.name: scamper.tracebox.dport
elements.desc: specifies the destination port for the packets being sent.

elements.name: scamper.tracebox.probe
elements.desc:
caracterizes the probe. Fields marked with a * can have
their value specified using parentheses (e.g.: TCP(18) sets
the TCP flags to SYN/ACK):
	-  Protocols: IP, IPV6, TCP*, UDP
	-  IP fields: ECT, CE, DSCP*, IPID*/IPFLOW
	-  TCP fields or options: ECE, MSS*, WSCALE*, MPCAPABLE,MPJOIN, SACK, SACKP, TIMESTAMP, MD5, TCPAO
	Example: -p IPV6/TCP/MSS/WSCALE/SACKP

elements.name: scamper.tracebox.hop.modifications
elements.desc: modifications as observed by Tracebox

elements.name: scamper.tracebox.values
elements.desc: retreive values of modified fields.

elements.name: scamper.tracebox.hop.ip4
elements.desc: hop v4 address which did answer to a Tracebox probe

elements.name: scamper.tracebox.hop.ip6
elements.desc: hop v6 address which did answer to a Tracebox probe

elements.name: scamper.tracebox.hop.icmp.payload.len
elements.desc: hop icmp TTL-expired packet quoting length

elements.name: scamper.ping.payload
elements.desc: specifies, in a hexadecimal string, the payload to include in each probe.

elements.name: scamper.ping.icmp.checksum
elements.desc: specifies the ICMP checksum to use when sending a probe.  The payload of each probe will be manipulated so that the checksum is valid.

elements.name: scamper.ping.dport
elements.desc: specifies the destination port to use in each TCP/UDP probe.

elements.name: scamper.ping.sport
elements.desc: specifies the source port to use in each TCP/UDP probe, and the ICMP ID to use in ICMP probes.

elements.name: scamper.ping.ttl
elements.desc: specifies the TTL value to use for outgoing packets.  By default, a value of 64 is used.

elements.name: scamper.ping.rcount
elements.desc: specifies the number of replies required at which time probing may cease.  By default, all probes are sent.

elements.name: scamper.ping.pattern
elements.desc: specifies the pattern, in hex, to use in probes.  Up to 16 bytes may be specified.  By default, each probe's bytes are zeroed.

elements.name: scamper.ping.method
elements.desc: specifies the type of ping packets to send.  By default, ICMP echo requests are sent. Choices are: icmp-echo, icmp-time, tcp-ack, tcp-ack-sport, udp, and udp-dport.

elements.name: scamper.ping.rr
elements.desc: specifies that the record route IP option should be used.

elements.name: scamper.ping.size
elements.desc: specifies the size of the probes to send.  The probe size includes the length of the IP and ICMP headers.  By default, a probe size of 84 bytes is used for IPv4 pings, and 56 bytes for IPv6 pings.

elements.name: scamper.ping.tos
elements.desc: specifies the value to use in the IPv4 ToS/DSCP + ECN byte.  By default, this byte is set to zero.

elements.name: scamper.trace.confidence
elements.desc: specifies that a hop should be probed to a specified confidence level (95% or 99%) to be sure the trace has seen all interfaces that will reply for that hop.

elements.name: scamper.trace.dport
elements.desc: specifies the base destination port value to use for UDP-based and TCP-based traceroute methods.  For ICMP-paris, this option sets the ICMP checksum value.

elements.name: scamper.trace.firsthop
elements.desc: specifies the TTL or HLIM value to begin probing with.  By default, a first hop of one is used.

elements.name: scamper.trace.gaplimit
elements.desc: specifies the number of unresponsive hops permitted until a check is made to see if the destination will respond.  By default, a gap limit of 5 hops is used.  Setting the gap limit to 0 disables the gap limit, but doing this is not recommended.

elements.name: scamper.trace.gapaction
elements.desc: specifies what should happen if the gaplimit condition is met.  A value of 1 (default) means halt probing, while a value of 2 means send last-ditch probes.

elements.name: scamper.trace.maxttl
elements.desc: specifies the maximum TTL or HLIM value that will be probed.  By default, there is no restriction, apart from the 255 hops that the Internet protocols allow.

elements.name: scamper.trace.M
elements.desc: specifies that path MTU discovery (PMTUD) should be attempted for the path when the initial traceroute completes.  scamper will not conduct PMTUD unless it is probing a respon sive destination, as otherwise there is no way to distinguish all packets being lost from just big packets (larger than MTU) being lost.

elements.name: scamper.trace.loops
elements.desc: specifies the maximum number of loops permitted until probing stops.  By default, a value of one is used.  A value of zero disables loop checking.

elements.name: scamper.trace.loopaction
elements.desc: specifies the action to take when a loop is encountered.  A value of 1 tells scamper to probe beyond the first loop in the trace.

elements.name: scamper.trace.payload
elements.desc: specifies the payload of the probe to use as a base.  The payload is specified in hexadecimal.  Note that the payload supplied is merely a base; the first 2 bytes may be modified to accomplish ICMP-Paris and UDP-Paris traceroute.

elements.name: scamper.trace.method
elements.desc: specifies the traceroute method to use.  scamper currently supports five different probe methods: UDP, ICMP, UDP-paris, ICMP-paris, TCP, and TCP-ACK.  By default, UDP-paris is used.

elements.name: scamper.trace.attempts
elements.desc: specifies the maximum number of attempts to obtain a response per hop.  By default, a value of two is used.

elements.name: scamper.trace.Q
elements.desc: specifies that all allocated probes are sent, regardless of how many responses have been received.

elements.name: scamper.trace.sport
elements.desc: specifies the source port value to use.  For ICMP-based methods, this option specifies the ICMP identifier to use.

elements.name: scamper.trace.srcaddr
elements.desc:
specifies the source address to use in probes.  The address cannot be spoofed.
The address cannot be spoofed.

elements.name: scamper.trace.tos
elements.desc: specifies the value to set in the IP ToS/DSCP + ECN byte.  By default, this byte is set to zero.

elements.name: scamper.trace.T
elements.desc: specifies that time exceeded messages from the destination do not cause the trace to be defined as reaching the destination.

elements.name: scamper.trace.userid
elements.desc: specifies an unsigned integer to include with the data collected; the meaning of the user-id is entirely up to the user and has no effect on the behaviour of traceroute.

elements.name: scamper.trace.wait
elements.desc: specifies how long to wait, in seconds, for a reply.  By default, a value of 5 is used.

elements.name: scamper.trace.waitprobe
elements.desc: specifies the minimum time to wait, in 10s of milliseconds, between sending consecutive probes.  By default the next probe is sent as soon as possible.

elements.name: scamper.trace.lssname
elements.desc: specifies the name of the local stop set to use when determining when to halt probing backwards; used with the double-tree algorithm.

elements.name: scamper.trace.gssentry
elements.desc:
specifies an IP address to halt probing when encountered; used
with the double-tree algorithm.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.confidence
elements.desc:
specifies the level of confidence we want to attain that there are no more parallel load balanced paths at a given hop.
 Valid values are 95 (default) and 99, for 95% confidence and 99% confidence respectively.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.dport
elements.desc:
specifies the base destination port to use.
Defaults to 33435, the default used by traceroute(8).

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.firsthop
elements.desc: specifies how many hops away we should start probing.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.gaplimit
elements.desc:
specifies how many consecutive unresponsive hops are permitted before probing down a branch halts.
Defaults to three.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.method
elements.desc: specifies which method we should use to do the probing. Valid options are: udp-dport, icmp-echo, udp-sport, tcp-sport, and tcp-ack-sport.  Defaults to udp-dport.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.attempts
elements.desc:
specifies how many probes we should send in an attempt to receive a reply.
Defaults to 2.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.maxprobec
elements.desc: specifies the maximum number of probes we ever want to send.  Defaults to 3000.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.sport
elements.desc:
specfies to the source port to use when sending probes.
Default based on process ID.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.tos
elements.desc:
specifies the value for the IP Type-of-service field for outgoing probes.
Defaults to 0.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.userid
elements.desc: specifies an unsigned integer to include with the data collected; the meaning of the user-id is entirely up to the user and has no effect on the behaviour of tracelb.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.waittimeout
elements.desc:
specifies in seconds how long to wait for a reply to a probe.
Defaults to 5.

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.waitprobe
elements.desc:
specifies in 1/100ths of seconds how long to wait between probes.
Defaults to 25 (i.e. 250ms).

elements.name: scamper.tracelb.result
elements.desc: a tracelb result line.
